Class SignUpController

java.lang.Object
com.example.gamerguard.controller.SignUpController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class SignUpController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the SignUp.fxml file. Handles user registration functionality.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller with the Gamer Guard logo image. Loads the logo image from the specified file path and sets it as the image source for the logoImageView.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • registerUser

      public boolean registerUser()
      Registers a new user by retrieving input, hashing the password, checking for email uniqueness, and inserting the user data into the database.
      Returns:
      true if registration is successful, false otherwise. The method performs the following steps:
      1. Retrieves user input from text fields and hashes the password.
      2. Checks if the email address is already registered.
      3. If the email is registered, displays an error message and returns false.
      4. If not, inserts the user data into the database and sets session information.

      Exceptions during email check or data insertion are caught, logged, and result in false being returned.

      Note: Assumes DatabaseConnection, HashInput, SessionInfo, and relevant UI components are defined and accessible.

    • termsAndConditionsHyperlinkOnAction

      public void termsAndConditionsHyperlinkOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event triggered when the terms and conditions hyperlink is clicked.

      This method loads the "termsandconditions.fxml" file to display the terms and conditions in a new window. The new window is set with a fixed size of 600x400 pixels. The controller for the terms and conditions view is obtained from the FXMLLoader, and the register button is passed to the controller for further interactions.

      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by clicking the terms and conditions hyperlink.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs while loading the FXML file.

    • registerButtonOnAction

      public void registerButtonOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event triggered by the register button.

      This method retrieves the input from text fields for first name, last name, email address, password, and confirm password. It validates that none of these fields are empty and that the password matches the confirmed password. If all validations pass, it attempts to register the user by calling registerUser(). If the registration is successful, it opens the dashboard by calling openDashboard(). If an IOException occurs during this process, it prints the stack trace.

      In case of validation failure, appropriate error messages are displayed on registerMessageLabel.

      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the register button

    • loginHyperlinkOnAction

      public void loginHyperlinkOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event when the login hyperlink is clicked. Loads the login form from an FXML file and sets it as the scene for the current stage.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by clicking the login hyperlink.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the FXML file.

    • openDashboard

      public void openDashboard() throws IOException
      Opens the dashboard scene.

      This method loads the "dashboard.fxml" file to create a new scene and sets it on the current stage. The scene's dimensions are defined by the constants HelloApplication.WIDTH and HelloApplication.HEIGHT. The current stage is obtained from the scene of the registerButton.

      Throws:
      IOException - if the FXML file cannot be loaded.

    • cancelButtonOnAction

      public void cancelButtonOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action event triggered by the cancel button. Closes the current stage and exits the application platform.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the cancel button.
